results.title: Data Warehouse Engineer
results.description:
Data Warehouse Engineer
Remote Opportunity

Do you like innovation and technology? We do, too. Reveleer is a healthcare software company serving health plans and care management organizations. Our teams are dedicated to disrupting and modernizing healthcare by building powerful technology that provides an amazing user experience, scalability, and automation.

Reveleer is the first of its kind in our space ‚Äì a self service platform that mines health data using AI, NLP, and advanced analytics. Our Platform enables health plans to focus on the quality of care people receive, leaving the most complex and repetitive tasks for technology to solve. Be part of what Reveleer is building next!

DUTIES

  • Design, implement and maintain SSIS Packages to handle all ETL needs
  • Design, implement and maintain load, stage, dimension, fact table (OLAP) structures to support the daily running of the data warehouse
  • Maintain the meta data and create relevant documentation
  • Develop approved data models and create data objects for the business users via SSRS, Dashboard tools and/or Excel
  • Monitor job execution times and apply enhancements to improve efficiency to SQL Agent Jobs and using Powershell and ADF (training will be provided on ADF and cloud-based solutions).

  • Monitor ETL jobs and troubleshoot any issues relating to the ETL jobs

KEY RESPONSIBILITY: Azure Enterprise Data Warehouse Support (Training will be provided on Azure SQL Dedicated Pool)

  • Granting and denying access to SQL Dedicated Pool

  • Monitor all the ETL jobs to make sure they are running as scheduled
  • Develop technical documentation
  • Any other duties as reasonably required

KEY MEASURABLES

  • All helpdesk tickets are responded to within agreed service level timeframes
  • Successfully provide timely feedback to users on their open helpdesks
  • Successfully provide support and assistance to the users at their level.
  • Successfully troubleshoot problems and provide level 1 support

Essential: Qualifications

  • Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, Software Development/Engineering, or Computer Science and/or other relevant disciplines Essential (BA/BS degree required):

Essential: Other

  • Microsoft Office Suite: Intermediate
  • Experience extracting data from SQL Databases, comma delimited files and other databases ¬∑ Intermediate Microsoft Excel and pivot controls experience
  • Experience with relational database concepts and structures
  • Experience with writing and understanding TSQL language Required (Expert Level)
  • Proficient in ETL development and maintenance with SSIS ¬∑ Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server administration and query plans, etc.
  • Knowledge of best practices/methodologies in Data Warehousing

Desirable:

  • Some Experience/Understanding with C# and or VB, web services and XML development
  • Some Experience/Understanding designing, creating and maintaining SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, Excel pivots and dashboards.
  • Understanding the levels of the development life cycle (Required)
  • Data Analysis experience
  • Ability to facilitate meetings with users to identify data visualization design prototypes
  • Some familiarity with Power BI or SSRS (desired but not required)
  • Excellent customer service skills

What You'll Receive:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Medical, Dental and Vision benefits
  • 401k
  • Generous PTO Plan

Reveleer is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis or race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law.

results.title: Recruiter/HR Specialist
results.description:
About Us:

Located in Seattle, Washington in the United States, CG Tech Services (cgtechservices.com) is a Managed Service Provider (MSP), focused on providing best in class IT support and cybersecurity services for businesses and not-for-profits of 5-1,000 employees.

Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled human resources specialist who is passionate about recruiting, and supporting and developing talent through our company's policies and procedures. Our ideal candidate will be responsible and reliable, experienced in recruiting work, screening, interviewing, and assessing candidates. They should be highly efficient, organized, and approachable. We expect applicants to have a solid knowledge of various HR functions and administrative responsibilities. Under limited supervision, the HR Recruiter Specialist provides support in functional areas of Human Resources which include recruitment, onboarding, personnel records, regulatory reporting requirements, benefits administration and other areas as needed. This is a fully remote position that would be working with existing and recruiting new team members in the United States, South Africa, the Philippines, and other countries.

This would be a good fit for someone who:

‚Ä¢ Is humble, motivated, and emotionally intelligent, specifically with a high degree of empathy.

‚Ä¢ Enjoys helping others succeed and sees their role as maximizing the output of their team.

‚Ä¢ Loves a faster-paced, no-drama environment where office politics, backstabbing, gossip, and negativity are not tolerated.

‚Ä¢ Is extremely detail-oriented and appreciates people who take an organized, systematic approach to achieving success.

‚Ä¢ Likes the idea of working for a smaller but growing company where their ideas and contributions directly impact the company‚Äôs success, direction, and growth.

‚Ä¢ Is a quick, self-motivated learner who wants to work for a company that will invest in their education.

‚Ä¢ Wants a position that will offer upward earning and career advancement; we want people who are interested in growth, learning, and becoming part of our team long-term.

Hours:
This is a full-time position of 40 hours a week. The expectation is that the majority of your hours worked would be Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM Pacific Time to collaborate with our team. However, hours will have some flexibility to conduct interviews with job candidates in various time zones.

Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Collaborates with department managers to identify and draft detailed and accurate job descriptions and hiring criteria.

‚Ä¢ Identifies and implements efficient and effective recruiting methods and strategies based on the available role, industry standards, and the needs of the organization.

‚Ä¢ Manage job posting and advertisement processes.

‚Ä¢ Attends and participates in online job fairs and recruiting events.

‚Ä¢ Maintain organizational charts and detailed job descriptions along with salary records

‚Ä¢ Screens applications and selects qualified candidates.

‚Ä¢ Prepare and distribute assessments and numerical, language, and logical reasoning test.

‚Ä¢ Schedules interviews, oversees preparation of interview questions, and other hiring and selection materials.

‚Ä¢ Update employee records with new hire information and/or changes in employment status.

‚Ä¢ Implement training and development plans as part of new team member onboarding.

‚Ä¢ Performs employee onboarding to include data entry into the HR Information system and new employee orientation. Ensures data entered is complete and accurate and provides guidance to employees ensuring they have a thorough understanding of company policies and procedures.

‚Ä¢ Assists in creating and updating the employee handbook.

‚Ä¢ Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and company policies.

‚Ä¢ Performs other duties as assigned.

Requirements

Skills & Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Successful work experience as a Human Resources Specialist, officer, recruiter, administrator, or other HR position

‚Ä¢ Strong working knowledge of HR functions and procedures (e.g., pay and benefits, recruitment, training, and development)

‚Ä¢ Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, using Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), and LinkedIn Recruiter

‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of or willingness to learn hiring strategies, labor laws, and employment diversity, equity, and inclusivity.

‚Ä¢ Commitment to staying current on the understanding of labor laws and disciplinary procedures.

‚Ä¢ Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn applicant-tracking software or other recruitment systems.

‚Ä¢ Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Ability to create and implement sourcing strategies for recruitment for a variety of roles.

‚Ä¢ Proactive and independent with the ability to take initiative.

‚Ä¢ Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with laws, regulations, and best practices applicable to hiring and recruitment.

‚Ä¢ Aptitude for critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision making.

‚Ä¢ Strength of character, ethics, commitment, reliability, and integrity.

Education & Experience:
Minimum of three (3) years of related work experience in HR, or a higher education degree and one (1) year of related work experience in Human Resources.

Physical Requirements:
Prolonged periods of sitting/standing at a desk and working on a computer, including VoIP phone calls and video meetings.

Other Requirements:‚Ä¢ You will need to provide your own computer that is running Windows 10/11.

‚Ä¢ Allow us to install software on your computer that keeps it up to date with security patches and anti-virus because we work with heavily regulated industries in the United States. Security precautions are paramount for us.

Benefits

Professional Development:

This position has the opportunity to grow into an HR Manager, Director of HR, or Chief Human Resources Office.

¬†

As this job posting is to an international audience with differing beliefs and cultural norms, please be aware that we are a progressive company with LGBTQIA+ team members and clients. While we respect and honor many forms of diversity, equity, and inclusivity, LGBTQIA+ people in the United States and other countries do not have equal protection nor treatment. This statement is not meant to exclude recognizing and celebrating other forms of diversity important to our team, but to be explicit in informing you of an important aspect of our team and clients.

results.title: HV Systems Field Support Engineer
results.description:
Volta Trucks, a hypergrowth European Electric Truck Manufacturer, is looking for a HV Systems Field Support Engineer to join our Electrical and Powertrain team. This is a travelling role with a requirement to provide onsite support inside and outside the UK.

This is a unique opportunity to join an ambitious scale-up where you will have the opportunity to contribute to the manufacturing strategy for a forward thinking, rapidly expanding business. The main purpose of the role is to diagnose and help to resolve issues with the HV systems on Volta's trucks across all phases of the development cycle.

What you will do:

  • Maintain a strong level of knowledge of the vehicle's electrical and software systems and architecture, with particular focus on the HV systems
  • Willingness to travel and be present at the location wherever issues are raised (domestic and international)
  • Be the ‚Äòfirst responder' to either diagnose and solve issues or collect the appropriate data/measurements for collaborative investigation with internal specialists and suppliers
  • Contribute to the documentation of investigation techniques to distribute knowledge within the team

We would like you to have:¬†

  • Experience debugging automotive electrical systems (preferably EVs)
  • Demonstratable experience working with EV HV systems
  • Qualified at IMI Level 4 or SAP level for working on HV systems
  • High level knowledge of automotive communication protocols ‚Äì CAN & LIN
  • Hands on experience of vehicle data logging and analysis using Vector CANalyzer
  • Ability to read and interpret electrical schematics and drawings
  • Experience interpreting system level software requirements

Our culture and Valued Behaviours

  • We are a scale-up, so structures and processes can be new and constantly evolving.
  • We are a diverse business, from many nationalities and backgrounds.
  • We really value our people. We have a flexible & remote work environment and a great benefits package & pension scheme.
  • You will have a genuine opportunity to make an impact on the business and society as a whole.
  • You should closely share our values of safety, sustainability, and electrification.
  • Be adaptable, resilient, and open to change

About us

Urban delivery is currently one of the most polluting activities in our cities. Traditional diesel trucks continue to pollute the air, and cause health and safety challenges to residents, while bringing necessary goods into city centres, because there hasn't been an alternative. Until now.

Volta Trucks has developed the first ground-up full-electric commercial vehicle, paired with an innovative and highly disruptive business model. Founded in 2019, and having raised ‚Ç¨300M of funding to date, we are bringing the full-electric Volta Zero to market at industry-leading pace and scale to help accelerate the transition to a sustainable future.

Enjoying our work and those we work alongside is what makes us Movista.

Our company headquarters are located in the heart of Bentonville, Arkansas, across the street from a museum and greenspace, just a 2-minute bike ride from all that the downtown art and market districts have to offer. We also have teammates reporting in from around the globe.

Job Summary:

The Sr. Director of Customer Success leads a team of Customer Success Managers responsible for all Movista customers following their initial implementation.¬† ¬†This role focuses on maximizing the value our customers receive from the Movista solution, thus driving adoption, customer satisfaction, and ultimately customer retention.¬†¬† In addition to leading the CSMs, the Sr Director of Customer Success has direct and frequent customer interaction at the leadership level, and demonstrates a firm command of our customers' business challenges and how the Movista solutions solve those challenges.

Responsibilities:

  • Establish and adhere to best practices in SaaS Customer Success.
  • Develop and demonstrate deep knowledge in the Movista ONE platform and the business processes surrounding retail in-store execution.
  • Recruit, hire, mentor and coach Customer Success team members.¬† Mentoring and coaching covers both Customer Success practices and processes as well as industry and solution expertise.
  • Serve as the escalation and resolution point for CSMs to address individual customer issues and concerns.
  • Interact with other areas of the Movista business to ensure customer success, such as Product and Engineering.
  • Foster a culture of metrics-driven performance in the Customer Success team.¬† Key metrics include customer adoption/usage, Net Promoter Score, renewals, and customer expansion.
  • Identify patterns of repeated challenges with existing customers, and drive those challenges to closure through people, process, and/or technology.
  • Establish and manage to a standard cadence of interactions across the customer base, at the tactical level and the strategic level.
  • In addition to Net Promoter Score, identify and monitor leading indicators of customer retention, in particular through analyzing adoption data and trends at the individual customer level.
  • Partner with our Professional Services organization to ensure seamless experience for our customers as they transition from initial implementation to ongoing production management.
  • Work closely with our Customer Care department leadership to seamlessly manage the end-user experience along with the overall customer experience.

Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of experience in customer success, professional services, or related customer-facing roles in software (preferably SaaS) or technology.
  • 3+ years direct hands-on team leadership and management experience.
  • Skilled at cross organizational collaboration and influencing interpersonally, at all levels, to build alignment and drive closure on issues and results.
  • Competency in the areas of analytical/financial thinking, creative problem solving, process development and strategic development.
  • Strong organizational and project management skills, excellent execution.
  • Direct exposure to Retail and/or operational execution software is preferred.
  • Must be able to manage multiple projects concurrently.
  • Comfort in a fast-paced, highly-dynamic environment with multiple stakeholders.
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

Physical Requirements:

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

Up to 30% travel may be required.

Working at Tidio means having an impact on thousands of companies and millions of their users. But our clients are not the only ones who can grow with us. By joining Tidio, you can grow, too!
